articles.headline: For Pornographers, Internet’s Virtues Turn to Vices
articles.snippet: The online availability of free or low-cost photos and videos has taken a fierce toll on sales of X-rated DVDs.
articles.abstract: The online availability of free or low-cost photos and videos has taken a fierce toll on sales of X-rated DVDs.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Internet was supposed to be a tremendous boon for the pornography industry, creating a global market of images and videos accessible from the privacy of a home computer. For a time it worked, with wider distribution and social acceptance driving a steady increase in sales.

articles.headline: Fingers That Keep the Most Treasured Violins Fit
articles.snippet: Andrea Mosconi, 75, keeps some of the world’s finest violins sounding sweet at a museum in Cremona, Italy.
articles.abstract: Andrea Mosconi, 75, keeps some of the world’s finest violins sounding sweet at a museum in Cremona, Italy.
articles.lead_paragraph: CREMONA, Italy — A violin, it turns out, needs to be played, just as a car needs to be driven and a human body shooed off the couch. In this city that produced the best violins ever made, that job belongs to Andrea Mosconi. He is 75, and for the past 30 years, six days a week, he has finger-fed 300-year-old violins, worth millions, a diet of Bach, Tchaikovsky and Bartok.

articles.headline: Who Benefits From This Buyback?
articles.snippet: Look at the shares of the nation’s 10th-largest seller of residential housing and you might think that the real estate bubble never popped.
articles.abstract: Look at the shares of the nation’s 10th-largest seller of residential housing and you might think that the real estate bubble never popped.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOOK at the shares of NVR Inc., the parent of Ryan Homes, Fox Ridge Homes and NVHomes, and you might just think that the real estate bubble never popped. The nation’s 10th-largest seller of residential housing, NVR has generated stock gains of 21 percent so far this year. Its seven largest peers — including D. R. Horton, Toll Brothers, the Lennar Corporation and KB Home — have posted losses ranging from 5.3 percent to 18.5 percent this year.

articles.abstract: Palm Inc., the struggling hand-held device company that makes the Treo, has reached a deal to sell a quarter of the company to a private equity firm for about $325 million.

articles.headline: Commanders Say Push in Baghdad Is Short of Goal
articles.snippet: Three months after the start of the operation, U.S. and Iraqi troops control less than a third of the city.
articles.abstract: Three months after the start of the operation, U.S. and Iraqi troops control less than a third of the city.
